001package com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.contracts;
002
003import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
004import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
005
006import com.pingidentity.did.sdk.client.service.model.ApplicationInstance;
007import com.pingidentity.did.sdk.types.Claim;
008import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.errors.WalletException;
009import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.storage.data_repository.DataRepository;
010import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.CredentialsPresentation;
011import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.PairingRequest;
012import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.PresentationMatcherResult;
013import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.PresentationRequest;
014import com.pingidentity.sdk.pingonewallet.types.PresentationResult;
015
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Map;
018
019import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
020
021public interface PingOneWalletClientContract {
022
023    /**
024     * Call this methods to register the optional storage manager that can be used by the SDK to maintain the values for claims and other data.
025     *
026     * @param storageManager Implementation of StorageManager interface
027     */
028    void registerStorageManager(@NonNull final StorageManagerContract storageManager);
029
030    StorageManagerContract getStorageManager();
031
032    /**
033     * Call this methods to get the data repository that can be used by the SDK to maintain the values for claims and other data.
034     *
035     * @return An instance of the DataRepository using registered StorageManagerContract
036     */
037    DataRepository getDataRepository();
038
039
040    /**
041     * Call this method to register your wallet and create a new application instance for your wallet.
042     * If an application instance already exists, the SDK will retrieve the same instead of creating a new one.
043     *
044     * @param callbackHandler Instance of WalletCallbackHandler to handle important events such as credential issuance/revocation etc.
045     */
046    void registerCallbackHandler(@NonNull final WalletCallbackHandler callbackHandler);
047
048    ApplicationInstance pairWallet(@NonNull final PairingRequest pairingRequest, @Nullable String pushToken) throws WalletException;
049
050    /**
051     * Call this method to pair your wallet app for future issuance and receive credential updates
052     *
053     * @param presentationRequest Request from service for wallet pairing containing the issuer ID and session id required for pairing
054     * @param pushToken           Optional push token
055     * @return ApplicationInstance Updated application instance for storage if a push token was supplied
056     * @throws WalletException Error when pairing wallet
057     *
058     * This method is deprecated and will be removed in upcoming updates. Use handleEvent instead
059     *
060     */
061    ApplicationInstance pairWallet(@NonNull PresentationRequest presentationRequest, @Nullable String pushToken) throws WalletException;
062
063    /**
064     * Update firebase push token to receive notifications from the service
065     *
066     * @param pushToken Firebase Push Token
067     * @deprecated
068     *
069     */
070    ApplicationInstance updatePushToken(@NonNull final String pushToken);
071
072    /**
073     * Update firebase push token to receive notifications from the service
074     *
075     * @param pushToken Firebase Push Token
076     * @return List of updated ApplicationInstance
077     */
078    List<ApplicationInstance> updatePushTokens(String pushToken);
079
080    /**
081     * Handle the URL for issuance or presentation.
082     *
083     * @param qrContent Raw content from the QR code
084     *
085     * This method is deprecated and will be removed in upcoming updates. Use processPingOneRequest instead
086     */
087    void processQrContent(final String qrContent);
088
089    /**
090     * Forward content from QR codes and universal links for processing. Make sure to register the callbackhandler beforehand to receive the result.
091     *
092     * @param request: Raw content from the QR code
093     */
094    void processPingOneRequest(final String request);
095
096    /**
097     * Forward content from push notifications payload for processing. Make sure to register the callbackhandler beforehand to receive the result.
098     *
099     * @param userInfo: Push notification payload
100     * @return boolean that is true if the notification can be handled by Wallet SDK and false if the SDK cannot recognize it as a PingOne notification
101     */
102    boolean processNotification(final Map<Object, Object> userInfo);
103
104    /** Check if there are any pending messages */
105    void checkForMessages();
106
107    /**
108     * Call this method to filter the verifiable credentials that match the schema defined in the input descriptor in the presentation request.
109     *
110     * @param presentationRequest Presentation Request for the verifiable credential
111     * @param claims              List of claims saved in the Wallet
112     * @return PresentationMatcherResult that contains the list of VerifiableCredentials matching the criteria defined in the presentation request
113     */
114    PresentationMatcherResult findMatchingCredentialsForRequest(@NonNull final PresentationRequest presentationRequest, @NonNull final List<Claim> claims);
115
116    /**
117     * Call this methods to send the verifiable presentation to the redirect uri defined in the presentation request.
118     *
119     * @param presentation CredentialPresentation object containing filtered credentials and presentation request
120     * @return VerifiablePresentationResult result returned after credential presentation
121     */
122    Single<PresentationResult> presentCredentials(@NonNull final CredentialsPresentation presentation);
123
124    /**
125     * Report when a credential is deleted from the Wallet.
126     * @param claim Claim that was deleted from wallet
127     */
128    void reportCredentialDeletion(@NonNull final Claim claim);
129
130
131}
